edu.ucla.sspace.fft
Class FastFourierTransform

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.fft.FastFourierTransform

public class FastFourierTransform
extends Object

Computes FFT's of DoubleVectors. The physical layout of the mathematical data d[i] in the array data is as follows: 

    d[i] = data[i0 + stride*i]
The FFT (D[i]) of real data (d[i]) is complex, but restricted by symmetry: 
    D[n-i] = conj(D[i])

Author:
Keith Stevens, Derived from JNT FFT code by Bruce R. Miller bruce.miller@nist.gov, Derived from GSL (Gnu Scientific Library), Contribution of the National Institute of Standards and Technology,

Method Detail

checkFactor

public static int checkFactor(int n)
Create an FFT for transforming n points of real, double precision data. n must be an integral power of 2.

transform

public static void transform(DoubleVector data,
                             int i0,
                             int stride)
Compute the Fast Fourier Transform of data leaving the result in data.

backtransform

public static void backtransform(DoubleVector data,
                                 int i0,
                                 int stride)
Compute the (unnomalized) inverse FFT of data, leaving it in place. The data must be in the same arrangement as that produced by transform.

bitreverse

public static void bitreverse(DoubleVector data,
                              int i0,
                              int stride)
This is the Goldrader bit-reversal algorithm
